pair.Prompt: In 1992, the Supreme Court of the United States heard the case FTC v. TICOR TITLE INS. CO.
pair.Response: Response: In FTC v. TICOR TITLE INS. CO., the Supreme Court of the United States heard a case involving six of the nation's largest title insurance companies. The Federal Trade Commission alleged that the companies had violated ยง 5(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act by engaging in horizontal price fixing in their fees for title searches and title examinations. The case was decided on June 22, 1992, with the Supreme Court ruling in favor of the title insurance companies.
